Docs.summary: This method is called when there is a new message to process, before the job function is invoked. This allows any preprocessing to take place on the message before processing begins.
Docs.returns: True if the message processing should continue, false otherwise.

Docs.param: The message to complete processing for.
Docs.summary: This method completes processing of the specified message, after the job function has been invoked.
Docs.remarks: If the message was processed successfully, the message should be deleted. If message processing failed, the message should be release back to the queue, or if the maximum dequeue count has been exceeded, the message should be moved to the poison queue (if poison queue handling is configured for the queue).
